abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Channel MaintenanceProject in Egypt.
            The rationale for the Bank Group's involvement in the
            subsector was to assist the Government of Egypt (GOE) to
            sustain and increase agricultural productivity, through the
            removal of major constraints hindering the performance of
            existing irrigation and drainage facilities. The performance
            of the Bank was less than satisfactory. The main lessons
            learned from the project include: (i) Substantial delays
            between Board presentation and Loan effectiveness should be
            taken into account when formulating projects for Egypt; (ii)
            The implementation of policy changes (total ban on all
            herbicides for channel maintenance) should not exclude the
            use of environmental friendly chemicals;  (iii) Transitional
            problems resulting from the divestiture of Public Excavation
            Companies (PEC)s should be taken into account and the
            Borrower should recognize the autonomous status of the PECs;
            (iv) When project ownership by the Borrower is in doubt and
            Government policy changes make project objectives
            unattainable, restructuring should result in a total
            re-evaluation of the project by the Bank; (v) Financial and
            contractual aspects, relating to the unit rates for works
            and length of work contracts, need to be adequate.
